title: Capturing electronic patient reported outcomes in oncology practice. - ASCO Publications

summary.text: The study highlights the importance of capturing electronic patient-reported outcomes (ePRO) in oncology practice to improve patient-centered care and decision-making.
Implementing ePRO tools can enhance communication between patients and healthcare providers by providing objective data on symptoms, functional status, and quality of life.

Utilizing ePRO in clinical settings requires robust infrastructure, standardized measurement tools, and effective integration with electronic health records to ensure seamless data capture and analysis.
